required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Study of a Novel Sublingual Aspirin Tablet
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Study of a Novel Sublingual Aspirin Tablet Compared to Conventional Oral Aspirin in Healthy Subjects

lead_sponsor.agency: Vita Green Health Products Co. Ltd

clinical_study.source: Vita Green Health Products Co. Ltd

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to compare the pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of a new sublingual formulation of aspirin with that of oral aspirin when administered to healthy volunteers under fasting conditions. The test product is sublingual aspirin 80 mg manufactured by Vita Green Health Products Co. Ltd, Hong Kong and the reference product is oral aspirin 80mg tablet manufactured by Synco (HK) Ltd, Hong Kong.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: single-dose, two-treatment, two-period, two-sequence, randomized, crossover design

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma-concentration time data of salicylic acid
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre dose and up to 24 hour post dose
primary_outcome.description: area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to last measurable concentration time point for sublingual versus oral aspirin 80mg

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak plasma concentration of salicylic acid
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre dose and up to 24 hour post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Peak plasma concentration for sublingual versus oral aspirin 80mg

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to reach peak plasma concentration of salicylic acid
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre dose and up to 24 hour post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax of sublingual versus oral aspirin 80mg

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal phase elimination rate constant of salicylic acid
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre dose and up to 24 hour post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Terminal phase elimination rate constant of sublingual versus oral aspirin 80mg

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal elimination half-life of salicylic acid
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre dose and up to 24 hour post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Terminal elimination half-life of sublingual versus oral aspirin 80mg

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration time data of thromboxane B2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre dose and up to 24 hour post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the curve for sublingual versus oral aspirin 80mg

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre dose and up to 360 minutes post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in platelet aggregation with sublingual versus oral aspirin 80mg

arm_group.description: Sublingual or oral aspirin 80mg tablet, single dose, two-treatment, two-period, two-sequence, randomized, crossover design, with washout 1-2 weeks

intervention.description: Vita Green Health Products sublingual aspirin 80 mg tablet

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male, 18 to 55 years of age
2. Body mass index between 18-27kg/m2
3. Accessible vein for blood sampling
4. High probability for compliance and completion of the study
5. No significant abnormalities in general physical examination
6. Subjects must agree to take effective contraceptive methods to prevent his partner pregnant during the time of first dose of study medication until one week of last dose administration
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of hepatic, renal, biliary, cardiovascular, gastrointestinal, haematological and other chronic and acute diseases within 3 months prior to screening
2. Clinically relevant abnormality in physical examination, ECG evaluation, urine test, blood chemistry or haematological test at the discretion of the investigator
3. Positive results for hepatitis B at screening
4. Moderate smoker (on average more than 2 cigarettes a day within 1 month prior to the start of first dosing)
5. Moderate consumption of alcohol (on average more than one drink per day within 1 month prior to start of first dosing)
6. Blood donation of more than 350 ml within 4 weeks prior to start of first drug dosing
7. Treatment of aspirin within 4 weeks before first dosing
8. Volunteer in any other clinical drug study within 2 months prior to start of first dosing
9. Hypersensitivity to aspirin or other drug in its class
